options.text: Cytochromes are found in cristae of mitochondria
After glycolysis, fate of glucose in mitochondrial matrix is reduction
Net gain of ATP in aerobic respiration is 36 ATP

There is one step in Kreb's cycle where  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>  reduced to  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> .

solution.text: After glycolysis, pyruvic acid formed in cytoplasm enters the mitochondrial matrix and undergoes oxidation which occurs by oxidative decarboxylation to release carbon dioxide, NADH<sub>2</sub> and form acetyl Co-A.
